Students wishing to go on to postgraduate
study are advised to investigate the following sources of
The main source of financial support for full time postgraduates
from England and Wales is provided in the form of studentships
offered by Research Councils and funding bodies which support
specified areas. To be eligible you should normally be a
UK citizen and expect to, or have obtained, a first or upper
second class honours degree. Competition is intense and
Full time and part time postgraduate students in arts or
humanities may be eligible for an Arts and Humanities Research
Full time social science students may be eligible for an
Economic and Social Research Council Award. For more information
Full time food studies/technology students may be eligible
for a Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council
This scheme allows people to borrow from &pound
for up to two years and is offered to candidates studying
for a vocational course who have no other means of support.
Repayments start up to one month after the end of the period
of training covered by the loan. Interest rates vary according
to the terms of the loan. For more information visit Directgov
Part time research students in any discipline may apply

column2: All Saints also provides a fund to support

column1: the modest research expenses of full time postgraduate students.
Applications should be made through your supervisor or course
director during your period of study.
Postgraduate students are also eligible to apply to the Access to Learning Fund for emergency or top up funding throughout their
course. You will be expected to show that you can meet your
tuition fees and that you have made reasonable provision
to support yourself through your course before we can consider
your application to the Fund. Applications are made via the Student Support Centre at

column2: All Saints once you have enrolled on your

column1: International students may be eligible for an Overseas Research
Student Award funded by the CVCP (Committee of Vice-Chancellors
and Principals). The award covers the difference in cost
between tuition fees for home/EU students and those for
international (non-EU) students, but does not cover living
expenses. Application forms are available from Trinity &amp
All Saints. Other sources for overseas students include
the British Council, for further information visit the British Council website
